name: seductiveness
content:
seductiveness noun [U]
(SEXUAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of making someone feel attracted to you and want to have sex with you: He has a sweet, boy-next-door seductiveness.
More examplesFewer examplesShe claimed, with outrageous seductiveness, that all she wore to bed was perfume.Hamilton moves with the slow, sultry, smiling seductiveness of a period movie star. Sanchez plans to teach her students pole dancing, combining seductiveness and fitness.

seductiveness noun [U]
(OF THING, IDEA)
an attractive quality that makes you want to do, have, or believe something: the dangerous seductiveness of new technology See
seductive
More examplesFewer examplesNahai is very aware of the seductiveness of stereotypes of the region. The entries in the index under A alone give you a tantalising glimpse of the book's scope and seductiveness.There is a distinct seductiveness about his style of cooking. An ever-present reminder, he always said, of the seductiveness of evil.
